alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:19AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Suffolk County through 915 AM EDT... At 818 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mount Sinai to Patchogue to near Robert Moses State Park. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Islip, Brentwood, Commack, Centereach, Shirley, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Medford, Hauppauge, Ronkonkoma, Manorville, Stony Brook, Babylon, Patchogue and Middle Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern New York.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk
